website_summaries.verdict: Amazon's Fire TV Stick is faster and less expensive than ever, and comes with an Alexa-enabled voice remote out of the box, making it the best budget-friendly media streamer you can buy.
pros: Comes with improved voice remote that can control your TV
Voice search and Amazon Alexa are very useful

customer_reviews.title: You are missing out
customer_reviews.text: One of the best purchases I have made. I like how easy it was to set up. I like how you speak and the tv responds 👍 I like how easy it is to stream with good quality pictures.
customer_reviews.author: House Husband

customer_reviews.title: So easy to set up (except for the remote!) and use
customer_reviews.text: I've never had any experience of Alexa before - what a revelation, it's Brilliant! The latest Fire TV stick arrived as promised on the release date (23 Jan 2019), and once I'd finally managed to get the remote opened (3 people's efforts and a googled solution later) and the batteries in, it was very easy to follow the prompts and set up. At the bargain price of £40 I'd recommend it to anyone. Oh, the solution to opening the remote is wear rubber gloves for better grip.......
customer_reviews.author: E.A.THORNHILL

customer_reviews.title: IMPOSSIBLE TO GET BACK OFF REMOTE WITHOUT DESTROYING IT IN THE PROCESS
customer_reviews.text: My first Fire Stick and only available since yesterday.WEDNESDAY JANUARY 22ND 2019. All the top class technology in the world and they can't design a plastic case which opens easily. There are LOTS of videos on You Tube about exactly the same problem on previous designs so this is nothing new.But Amazon have ignored all this historical information and not included advice on their own Help pages . I still can't open mine. The hammer beckons. Any advice Amazon? -And there is no option to give this ZERO stars which would have been my preference.
customer_reviews.author: Alex. Dewart

customer_reviews.title: Needs work.
customer_reviews.text: Had a lot of problems keeps saying Internet is down check the router but all that is fine have to reset the stick all the time...
customer_reviews.author: Dan laplain

customer_reviews.title: Does not pair with Echo
customer_reviews.text: Plugged in the fire tv stick, tried to pair the remote with echo as suggested in quick set up guide (useless by the way) this didn’t work so thought I would set up the remote/FireStick/tv combo first. This was straight forward and I was able to activate voice commends to tv via remote BUT what I wanted to do was to command via my Echo without holding the remote. So I then spent an extremely frustrating hour trying to get the two to pair, googling etc for help. Nothing will make these two pair and no Amazon help available on line... ‘trouble shooting help’ consists of telling you to do the same thing that didn’t work... Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Moz33

customer_reviews.title: Amazon 4k Fire Stick
customer_reviews.text: This New 4K Fire Stick is more powerful than the 1st and 2nd Generations released. Not just for use to stream in 4k, You can still stream and watch Films/ Movies Sports etc in 1080p / 720p etc. Includes new Functions after set up, Volume control for your Tv / Power on/off /mute button. All you need to do is connect it to your HDMI Connection on your device and connect to your Internet. This is by far the best low cost streaming device out at the moment .
customer_reviews.author: neil jones

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, does what it says.
customer_reviews.text: Bought another firestick to add to our other one particularly for the volume controls as our old control for our amp was on the way out. Excellent, easy setup, picked up our cheap digihome tv to control the power and when it did not control the volume on the tv asked if we had it connected to an output which we do. It took 12 attempts to pick up our old philips surround sound system but it worked which is impressive as our system is years and years old. We can now control our tv, surround sound and firestick all from the one control which is far more convenient for us. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Hodgkinson

customer_reviews.title: Works well so far.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup. Most time taken was opening the remote control case to put the batteries in (very poor design) but everything you need in the box including batteries, extension HDMI cable, USB power adapter and some basic instructions. Setup was fairly intuitive - took a while to set up all the apps with my credentials (some needed registration first) using the on-screen keyboard but this isn't really anything Amazon can fix easily I guess.
customer_reviews.author: N. Royle

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! I bought this for my projector and it definitely worth it. I can download all my TV shows from BBC Iplayer, itv hub and much more! The quality is also very good. Alexa works great too. Having amazon prime allows me to also watch the latest movies on my TV which is a plus. Couldn't fault the product.
customer_reviews.author: Dharmika

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love it !!
customer_reviews.text: Simply plug it in and you’re ready to enjoy an amazing array of fun with music, movies, games.... you name it ,straight on your tv. Absolutely chuffed with the purchase and would recommend it to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Mika

customer_reviews.title: Unstable
customer_reviews.text: I have used my fire stick once since purchase (28th January 2019) and now it will not load live TV. I bought the device to take with me when I travel with my work but now when I try to stream live TV all I get is Error Code 403, what a waste of money. What makes it worst is when you look for a telephone number to call customer services or some other way to contact Amazon, no help what so ever.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Hastings

customer_reviews.title: Caution: requires paid subscription to Amazon PRIME
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so my mother-in-law can stream iPlayer. Despite the description on the website -"Simple to set up and use" (1. Plug into HDTV 2. Plug into wall socket 3. Connect to Internet and enjoy) - what Amazon don't tell you is you need to pay £7.99 per month for their PRIME service in order to make this work. We only found this out when we called their tech support line.
customer_reviews.author: Annoyed of Tunbridge Wells

customer_reviews.title: Alexa voice remote.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second fire stick,son took first one for his tv in his bedroom. He loves all the channels so I have bought this one. That good I had to buy another. This all new alexa voice remote fire stick ,4k is more powerful than the ones before. Everything is included to set up. Excellent item and I do recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Redmond

customer_reviews.title: No internet connection...
customer_reviews.text: Previous generation works absolutely fine, but from the start this one connects to the WiFi fine but then says no internet connection available. Intermittently works. Every other device in the house is fine, as well as previous fire stick. Waste of money unless they fix whatever bug this is
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Powell

customer_reviews.title: Tip to open remote
customer_reviews.text: Like a lot of people I found it almost impossible to open the back of the remote to put the batteries in.....until. Go to Youtube and find a video entitled "How to open Amazon Fire TV Remote easily". This guy suggests donning rubber gloves to get a better grip, but that didn't help me. Then he suggests a trick using sellotape. Bingo. Didn't get it fully open but opened it enough for me to easily insert a knife to prise it fully open. Give that a go. Absolutely ridiculous, Amazon, that so amy people should have to go to such lengths to open your shockingly poorly designed remote.
customer_reviews.author: Phiz Boz

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to open remote control to insert batteries for Firestick (not very happy)
customer_reviews.text: Fire stick worked great,but i found it impossible to open back of remote control to insert batteries with out damaging the remote cover,i tried endless tools after struggling to slide open cover with my fingers,not enough grip with the slight indentation on remote cover,ended up haveing to use a sharp knife then a screw driver to prize the cover off,in doing so the knife & screwdriver both slipped scratching the back of the remote control very badley,i suppose i will have to put up with this controler now as i damaged it myself because the cover was too stiff to move,this is the first time i've had to complain about any of Amazon's products ,Bye for now Geoff
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey

customer_reviews.title: For Prime excellent
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for finding anything on Prime but for UK people it won’t find anything on BBC or ITV channels. If anyone finds away of doing it perhaps they’d let us know how it’s done.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great price.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up using amazon account. Is perfect for using to stream media and has allowed me to benifit from my prime account watching the free programs on amazon video. Would highly recommend this product to anyone wanting to stream movies and series using apps such as Netflix, Iplayer, all4 and so on. Alex works well for searching for media on the installed but not so much for accessing the Internet. Still, am very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: GrimReefa

customer_reviews.title: Firestick - amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Firestick arrived next day (obvs) - was so easy to set up, the remote is very easy to use recognises each key on the screen key board - much better than traditional TV remotes Getting the back off the remote was easy too - so that has clearly been fixed (looking at all the previous problems written here) It took no more than 10 minutes to set up - was so intuitive - I was very impressed! Thank you
customer_reviews.author: SC

customer_reviews.title: Amazon,  what a joke,  they really don't like the truth.  Sell me a broken firestick  .  DISGUSTING
customer_reviews.text: Would not pair the volume button, even after five attempts. But apart from that,it all works correctly Still disappointed though For the life of me cannot understand why it won't pair with a smart tv, just bought another, with exactly the same problems two broken in the same week. Amazon had the nerve to ask for me to pay for it returned Shocking customer service Buy elsewhere,these are faulty When your buying in knocked down deals Two remote control broken,you just couldn't make it up. Thanks for nothing AMAZON
customer_reviews.author: stephen t

customer_reviews.title: Not that good,  disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I expected something better, you have to try a few times to get what you want. I use the buttons on the control more than the voice control.
customer_reviews.author: GEORGE R TATTERS

customer_reviews.title: Volume controls not working with projector
customer_reviews.text: Brought an updated Fire TV Stick just for the volume controls, sadly... the volume controls don't work.
customer_reviews.author: Simon Bao

customer_reviews.title: Quality very poor with Plex Server
customer_reviews.text: Trying to use the Fire TV stick with our Plex server, and gave up because of the poor quality. Some playbacks were jittery, some had low resolution, some lost video/audio sync. It's not due to WiFi contention, as the connection was using the Ethernet adaptor, and over the 100 Mb cable. Tried changing various settings on Plex, reducing bandwidth, etc. but nothing helped.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Culshaw

customer_reviews.title: Only a streaming device no live TV.
customer_reviews.text: I have had my Firestick for a while now, I purchased it to watch Netflix and Live TV. I was using an app call TVplayer to watch live tv but they have now changed the service and you can only get a few channels without paying for yet another subscription! I have contacted Amazon and they have no control over third party apps (TvPlayer) but offer no way of watching Live Tv. So if one of the reasons you are buying a Firestick is to watch LiveTv Freeview channels I would find another way! Amazon have no idea how to help with this and will only pass free back on!
customer_reviews.author: Donna Darcey

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: This is the third time I have had a problem. The first one stopped working. I bought a second one and it stopped working after I got a new WiFi router - I wasn’t able to input the new password. And now o find I got one - flagged up by your special Amazon Prime offer that only works on HDTVs. It’s a real hassle returning and it’s the last time I buy: the offer is over now. Amazon Prime is determined to ensure I can’t watch it on my tv and only on my tablet. Really disappointed. And no way to contact Amazon Prime for advice.
customer_reviews.author: C. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Love this so much I bought another
customer_reviews.text: This is my second fire stick, and it was bought to put in a second room. The set up is very easy. I plugged it in and followed the on-screen instructions and it was set up within 5 minutes. As this is my second stick, it meant all I had to do was log into my Amazon account and it was added. This one has Alexa voice remote, and again is very straight forward and easy to use. You can ask Alexa to find a film or ask about the weather etc. For the price of Amazon Prime you get a good variety of films and programmes.
customer_reviews.author: J Inglis

customer_reviews.title: Fails where it's predessor excelled
customer_reviews.text: This is my 4th Fire TV stick and a direct replacement for the last model which we have put on a different TV. I set the new stick up exactly the same way as the one it was replacing. Same old setup no problem, but after two nights of iplayer buffering and failing I switched back to the previous model and the problems went. Not sure what they've done with this version but it's not working for us. I wonder whether it only really works with 5g? I've put it in another room which has 5g so we'll see how we get on. But so far, 1 star, very dissapointed.
customer_reviews.author: AdamC

customer_reviews.title: Fire TV stick
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 fire stick in my home and I am probably one of the biggest amazon fan but I have one major issue. All my fire sticks keep crashing regularly, losing connection coming up with error or network down and they all need constant resetting via disconnecting network and reconnecting. I have noticed all the fire sticks seem to overheat which make me thinks it is a design issue. You should be able to watch & use these sticks without them constantly crashing! When they work, they are amazing and the picture quality is fantastic. What a shame...
customer_reviews.author: LaNiçoiseàBiggleswade

customer_reviews.title: Stop Working in Less than 6 months. 1 Star is Generous.
customer_reviews.text: The first stick I received stopped working in less than 6 months, provided a consistent blank screen and three loading dots. Amazon advised me to return the item and they sent out a refurbished item in Nov 18. This worked well until March 19, where I had the same blank screen and white dot issue. At this point I contacted amazon to report the issue, they advised that the original warranty had expired and that I should purchase a new device. Amazingly this was the best customer service that could be offered after supplying two faulty devices within a year to a paying customer. Avoid and look at alternative options.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Not happy.
customer_reviews.text: Still not able to use. Phoned in they said they would help me over the phone. That's no good , old lady that not good with Technology. Was told it was my with my wi fi strange first fire stick I bought is working so is my PC and Sky TV. I am one of those people that rely on TV as housebound and not able to go out.So no I'm not happy but still not much I can do.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: So so handy
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd firestick. I love the new remote which allows you to control the tv volume and turn the tv off and on. Really good free apps like iPlayer itv hub. Not to mention Amazon prime video. Pic above is the difference in the two remotes. I have this firestick at the far end of the house and it has not buffered at all. Really good Wi-Fi pickup
customer_reviews.author: Gary A.

customer_reviews.title: What a waste of money
customer_reviews.text: After using it for about a few hours over 18 months all I am left now is an Amazon logo. Absolute waste of money. A lot of people seem to have the same problem. Why don't they fix it, may be they want people to buy another. I was offered 25% discount but I don't think I will waste my money any more. There are other devices which are a lot cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Taz

customer_reviews.title: A really, really good gadget with few limitations
customer_reviews.text: An excellent portable media system, ideal for when you're travelling and want your Netflix etc with you on any TV. Impressively simple to set up and use. The only issue was getting the remote open to put the batteries in - but a sharp knife moved it the 2mm needed to get it open. One of the best buys I've made in ages, overall - will be even better when the roll out of Apple Music happens.
customer_reviews.author: CMEdinburgh

customer_reviews.title: No buffering on TV shows since getting this stick!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, I can't believe we've waited so long to upgrade from our gen1 firestick to this one. It's so much better! We've been watching (with great annoyance) everything with bad buffering. It didn't even occur to us to get the latest stick! We ended up buying this because we had lost the remote to our gen1 and were using the firestick remote app, which is mega annoying and we just had enough. Since getting this stick, NO BUFFERING WHATSOEVER! It's brilliant. Plus Alexa is providing much entertainment for my children! We can now enjoy our Amazon Prime and Netflix TV shows with no issues at all.
customer_reviews.author: Bec Webb

customer_reviews.title: The remote will kill you
customer_reviews.text: I have a fire stick which served us well. We decided to get another for our holiday home. Are they joking? The remote has proved, so far, impossible to open to insert batteries. Looking at a lot of reviews this seems to be a common problem. They need to sort this out. If you can't open it you can't use it. The design is crap Null points!
customer_reviews.author: Ian Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Easy to get on with
customer_reviews.text: Arrived day following order, read instructions and installed within 15 minutes, watching first video within 20 minutes. So easy even I managed it! Lots of choice covering all types of film. Not sure about the bolt on extras but does exactly what I want.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Cleeve

customer_reviews.title: Wait 5 years and this will be perfection!
customer_reviews.text: Firstly it's a clever gismo in such a small device but I think while it's good at voice recognition the actual content is messy to navigate. Plex won't work, says looking for server all the time so you don't get anywhere with it. Amazon music steams quite well but not every title is the original recording, some are from live performances, I guess copyright issues? You have to register for iPlayer, and most free apps which is a chore. Streaming quality on some is poor, Sky News for example is grainy. My verdict in another 5 years Amazon will have probably perfected these devices to perfection, it's called technical evolution!
customer_reviews.author: Bosely

customer_reviews.title: Not suitable for older TVs
customer_reviews.text: My TV is an older but perfectly functioning Panasonic, so the screen does not go right to the edge of the frame. As a result I lose the entire edge of the Firestick picture. The TV's zoom function obviously makes no difference because whenever I zoom the Firestick still thinks my screen goes right to the edge of the TV frame and calibrates accordingly. Apparently you could adjust the picture size on older Firesticks. but Amazon would probably prefer you to buy a new TV - not good for the pocket or the environment
customer_reviews.author: Bluebell

customer_reviews.title: Cannot Calibrate Image from Device!!
customer_reviews.text: Why have Amazon made it impossible to calibrate the image from the Firestick itself?!? I was able to do this on the first generation one I had that recently broke...or the image calibrated automatically. I can't remember. Either way, with my second generation Firestick I am unable to calibrate the image either from the device itself or on our Sony television and so the image is cropped on all four sides. The only upshot I see is that we can now watch Bandersnatch...
customer_reviews.author: Mr TT Fair

customer_reviews.title: Just what you'd expect from amazon... Quality stuff
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty incredible the amount of sophisticated electronics you can get for such low prices these days! This costs about the same as a raspberry pi 3, but it's better in everyway as an alternative to a TV and streaming. It comes with a remote that has voice integration. The only issue I have is thst the OS is quite limited, much like the fire OS on amazon's tablets. As a code developer and engineer it really bugs me when I'm not free to tinker with electronics... Well not easily at least. Get this and a computer monitor say goodbye to TV license /tax nonsense!!!
customer_reviews.author: Atiq .A

customer_reviews.title: Total trash. Still
customer_reviews.text: Freezes constantly, now does nothing. Recieved as a gift. Would definatly not buy another. Ready to chuck it out the window and buy a chromecast. UPDATE. Spent 30 minutes online with customer service who were zero help. Repeatedly told me to try the same thing over and over that just didn't work. Thanks for nothing. Seems to work well as a door wedge though so all is not lost. Our second one has now done the exact same thing. Amazon still zero help... wish I'd bought a chrome cast. Offered me 30% discount to buy another. Gone to basket and now showing 15% discount. Actual nightmare.v
customer_reviews.author: SJG

customer_reviews.title: 39£ wasted
customer_reviews.text: The worst purchase ever!! Only issues since this arrived !! Streaming quality horrible although my WiFi connection is excellent (in fact I can watch everything from pc but not on my tv using this stupid fire stick ) then remote control not working they send me a new one but it’s not new it’s refurbished and guess what? Not working !! Now i am waiting a third one hope the last one
customer_reviews.author: margherita

customer_reviews.title: Far more user friendly that accessing Prime via a Smart TV or Blu Ray player
customer_reviews.text: After persevering with the usable but clunky user interfaces of 1 Smart TV and 2 different Blu Ray players I decided to bite the bullet and buy a Fire Stick.. Installation was easy, took taking no more than 15 minutes and in the 3 months we've owned it the Fire Stick has performed flawlessly without any of the annoying quirks the 'smart' devices we used previously had (having to sign in to Amazon every time we switched on being the biggest) and with a generally more user friendly user interface. You can also disable the microphone in the remote if you have no interest in having Alexa in your home.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: enjoying it, have gone, roku, chromecast now fire TV
customer_reviews.text: having just started looking into voice controls, we started wit a chromecast as we all have android phones, that got a bit annoying, so changed it out for a Fire TV stick with a remote. really like he speed of it... smooth (better than the roku we had before), the range of streaming apps is better than the chromecast... that needed a phone to cast most channels which was a shame... The push to talk is good, I dont like the idea that google was listening 100% of the time... the button is good. only downside is if you are watching something and ask alexa a question, it stuffs up your streaming, and you have to restart all that...
customer_reviews.author: Craig D

customer_reviews.title: Voice commands/alexa doesn't seem to work
customer_reviews.text: The amazon Fire TVs stick in itself is amazing. I love being able to stream straight to the tv, it's very competitively priced and easy to use. The voice recognition and alexa integration however doesn't respond to even simple requests (an example putting the subtitles on or anything else). There is no point to it because it doesn't work and I would rather not having a microphone on a piece of equipment in my home, especially when it doesn't benefit me.
customer_reviews.author: candygirl

customer_reviews.title: Works but with overheating issues.
customer_reviews.text: Overheats when used for around an hour, after researching it seems this isn't an isolated issue and these units regularly overheat for other users, after having to turn it off after 40mins of use to cool down I got fed up and elected to install a heat sink. I removed the external shroud and added a headsink to the internal plate and have had no issues since. It's rather dissapointing that these are shipped with this obvious flaw.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Good untill the update
customer_reviews.text: Was working fine but now drops signal every night when we are watching programmes. WiFi drops every night meaning we have to reset it. only just started after the update. watching films/TV on device was something we decided to do as an alternative paying £100's to sky each month. to start we had a stable connection no it drops constantly leaving us to reset every time. as I know its not my internet connection (1GB up and download speeds). something they need to sort out.
customer_reviews.author: ragman

customer_reviews.title: Superb alternative to Satellite set-up in a Motorhome
customer_reviews.text: I have pretty decent Mifi connectivity in our Motorhome and find the firestick a far better, and easier, alternative to satellite dishes and receivers (which we have). Far wider selection of programmes and content, streams very well in full HD. Cannot get Skygo working on this (competition with Now TV and all that) - but I just use Skygo on my tablet when I need my Game of Thrones fix ! :) We mostly watch the included streaming services on the Firestick anyway - Netflix, Prime, BBC-Iplayer, etc. We should have invested in one of these from the start and saved the expense of Satellite dishes etc.
customer_reviews.author: POC

customer_reviews.title: Fire is better than Roku
customer_reviews.text: Firstly No remote problems as the back came off easily to install batteries. I had a Roku Express & thought I’d try Fire. Paid £29.99. Excellent 1080p picture & excellent Dolby Digital sound. I only got PCM stereo with Roku. I can also use the 5ghz WiFi channel, only 2.4ghz with Roku. Took minutes to set up. Came with everything needed. Extender cable, batteries. Overall it’s a better package than Roku Express. Fire offers lots more than Roku for about the same price. Also finally Roku customer service stinks.
customer_reviews.author: Rod M.

customer_reviews.title: This fire stick is excellent and has improved my viewing experience
customer_reviews.text: I found it a bit of a “faff” to set up, but managed, triumphantly, to do it - not so easy for a 73 year old technophobe! Once installed I was delighted with how it improved my picture and meant that BBC iPlayer and Amazon Prime and Netflix did not “drop out” which I used to find very frustrating when watching and would often have to restart. So although I was fed up that my TV would not get Amazon Prime any longer, I have been delighted with the fire stick as suggested by an Amazon employee, and would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs A.J. Bates

customer_reviews.title: Only works Intermittently
customer_reviews.text: There are a lot of apps available and when it works it is very good. However we very seldom get through a long show on UKTV or Youtube without the firestick losing network connection and hanging. The signal strength is very good and other devices such as laptop or phone work fine in the same room. I have tried following suggestions to stop unnecessary apps running in the background but it does not cure the problem. I have 2 fire sticks for TVs which no longer support apps such as BBC iPlayer, and the same thing happens on both. It is obviously a design flaw. There are hundreds of similar complaints on various forums.
customer_reviews.author: MS

customer_reviews.title: Disney plus!
customer_reviews.text: Great! Have to admit I'm not using it to its fullest as I only purchased it to use for disney plus on the TV as my current television isn't compatible with the app but picture quality is great, no buffering or lag considering we've go tons devices connected at once... And kids love the fact they can watch on the TV, the extras are all a bonus.
customer_reviews.author: MRS T Bk

customer_reviews.title: Data extinction
customer_reviews.text: Well i came to the fire stick by accident, thinking it had football as an option. It was advertising football over the Christmas season and i had a punt. Unfortunately for me not being a technical person was unaware of the high data usage. And data extinction soon became a real concern. I only have a ee hub WiFi connection with limited Gigs, i was topping up like an addict. So if you don't have unlimited data. Its a bad buy. If you're data is unlimited then yes. The football was a one off catch.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Goulding

customer_reviews.title: Small but powerful
customer_reviews.text: This little media stremaer allows you to watch prime video and other services such as youtube and iplayer on your tv and is really fast. I also love that you can install android apps on this device and can even run games on it which is super amazing considering how cheap this is. The WiFi on it works really fast and a feature that I use often in the screen mirroring function which allow you to mirror your smartphone or laptop screen to your tv screen and it works flawlessly. Small in size so does not stick out or anything like other devices on the market really happy with this purchase and would strongly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: MR GADGET

customer_reviews.title: Kept freezing
customer_reviews.text: We have an old Fire TV Stick that works on all of our TV sets and we bought a second one which now comes with Alexa voice control. It constantly freezes and buffers despite our WIFI signal being recorded as "very good" with "no issues". I can see from internet reviews that I am not alone in finding that this "new generation" Fire Stick isn't a patch on the original. We are returning it.
customer_reviews.author: alison

customer_reviews.title: So fast!
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a free upgrade when my original Firestick stopped working. Fantastic experience with Amazon's customer service who could tell I had been struggling with my old device for weeks. No number of reboots, re-installs, factory resets, switching off, resetting etc had worked so I contacted Amazon who talked me through what to do for a final time and then offered me this new, upgraded version. It is *SO* fast. Loading is much faster, but once at the menus everything is so much slicker, so smooth, so fast. Picture quality is excellent and it's great to have a volume control on the remote. Great value. Great support. Loving it.
customer_reviews.author: Nozza

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: I have just converted my non smart tv to a smart tv thanks to this.which has saved me a lot of money. Literally plug it into your hdmi port in tv, plug other end into mains power and you're ready to go. + Has access to YouTube, netflix, all the catch up platforms, apps, amazon video, pretty much anything + Really easy to cast from YouTube on phone to the tv. + The remote is quality Should have got this sooner!
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Power button, mute & volume control don’t work
customer_reviews.text: Don’t expect power button, volume control or mute button to work on Firestick controls. This was second replacement for getting in another room and quite frankly a poor upgrade in regards to setting up given how simple it’s predecessor was to set up. Everything within the device works fine but the extras on the remote are a waste of time. I’m not going through amazon chat with 3 different people all over again over something that clearly doesn’t work.
customer_reviews.author: Act1ve

customer_reviews.title: complicated
customer_reviews.text: i found it a little complicated to use. I cant use Alexa because i have a voice disability and couldn't find a firestick without Alexa. i wanted Alexa for normal tv and the films but I couldn't find a channel that gave me normal tv and programme guide. I'm not good with technology so maybe I shouldn't of ordered it. I gave up and am still paying sky bill :( everything i tried to use would go to amazon account and i would get email, they wouldn't delete from stick and then to top it all anything i tried to watch it would ask for account details, but say this was not recognised.
customer_reviews.author: nicola lewis

customer_reviews.title: Remote too Remote
customer_reviews.text: Pretty easy to set up and good picture quality. Can’t complain for£19.99 when on offer to Prime members BUT, annoying unable to set up the remote control to adjust TV volume or turn TV on and off. Followed all the directions several times but simply impossible. Irritating therefore to have to use two remote controls . Accordingly only half the functionality of the TV Stick remote available which is daft to say the least!! Alexa no help either!
customer_reviews.author: Smudger

customer_reviews.title: Connectivity and streaming issues
customer_reviews.text: Streaming really needs more buffering or caching of the video. Or even better, a download option as on mobile phones, so that when my internet is down im not left without anything to watch. The remote needs to be able to change any connected Bluetooth headset volume too. Finally, the Bluetooth interference with WiFi 2.4ghz is a serious inconvenience which, through 5ghz WiFi can be rectified completely, except for the fact that this firestick only offers connectivity to a handful of 5ghz channels. I'm misfortunate enough to have interference issues on this channels. Overall, you can imagine the kind of frustrations I tend to experience when watching anything in my downtime. Otherwise ok
customer_reviews.author: J Haz

customer_reviews.title: This power stick needs the supplied adapter
customer_reviews.text: Not sure about Alexa integration. This review is about first powering up. The Fire Stick nay need more power than your TV USB can provide. You will see this if it gets stuck in the initial optimisation sequence. The solution is to use the Amazon 5 watt charger and cable provided. But there is a solution if you don't want the separate charger. If your TV has two USB ports you can get a USB coupler like this:  I had a spare 3 male one and bought an extra female to mini (?) adapter.
customer_reviews.author: Roy124

customer_reviews.title: This is a fabulous piece of kit
customer_reviews.text: This is a fabulous piece of kit. My adult children have been nagging me to buy a smart tv for ages. Having just dumped sky due to cost I bought a firestick for under £30 . I thought for that price I have nothing to lose. The options and choice are incredible. I am no techno whizz by any stretch but the firestick more or less installed itself. I've had it a couple of weeks and still haven't sussed all the option available to me. My wife is also very happy with it! Can't recommend this enough.
customer_reviews.author: Zeppland

customer_reviews.title: Digital TV channels don't all download properly
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used Alexa much as I'm still old fashioned and using a remote...haha. However the few times I have it's been good at recognising exactly what I'm saying. I would say stream quality can be off at times...I've had to switch the whole system off several times when it's lots a wireless signal. I've also had to reboot a few times after it wouldn't switch on in the morning. I'm not sure if it's just temperamental with dropping a signal cos my Internet signal is excellent. The digital TV app has also failed to download properly and I'm missing several basic channels which is disappointing as I can't see anyway to fix this.
customer_reviews.author: Lorna Cheung

customer_reviews.title: Reduction of £10 in the price the day after ordered
customer_reviews.text: Product ok but a bit miffed that I ordered the item one day at £39.99 and the next day it was priced at £29.99, my remittance was taken from my account on the same day as it was reduced so would have thought I would have benefitted from the reduction as a valued customer
customer_reviews.author: K Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Buffering & “no internet connection”
customer_reviews.text: My previous 1st gen fire stick had worked fine until this year when it kept saying “no internet connection” and buffering. So I decided to upgrade to the newer version which to my annoyance had exactly the same problems! Last night settled down to watch the Invisible Man film and the buffering and no internet connection messages kept appearing on screen. I have vodafone gigafast broadband, over 200 mps, nothing else buffers, all other gadgets work perfectly. I noticed I can now stream prime video from my iPad to tv, and guess what - no buffering or internet connection “issues”! So luckily I’m within the return period and will be returning the fire stick asap.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya

customer_reviews.title: Amazon Fire Stick with voice surround.
customer_reviews.text: Yes someone bought it for a present for me I must admit I dont use the voice much but I do like the little stick and it has a good presentation I generally like to look at the menu at the top and then zoom in to what I want to watch.
customer_reviews.author: maggie

customer_reviews.title: It’s just superb!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this.. it’s fab. For anyone who isn’t sure about what this does basically it’s interactive has Alexa so you can direct it to where you want it to go, has games. Apps, Netflix, iplayer, you tube, prime etc the list goes on. I’ve cancelled my sky contract now as I can get most things on this plus it’s a lot faster too. It streams well and quickly. This is the second one I’ve bought for my household. It’s great !
customer_reviews.author: Rolacolalola

customer_reviews.title: Now works in Ireland
customer_reviews.text: Update (August 2020) Amazon has unlocked the fire stick to work for Irish customers. The product now works as intended.
customer_reviews.author: Gaz

customer_reviews.title: In control
customer_reviews.text: Well we already had a "Fire Stick" so why did we need another? It was a good price and was "Alexa" enabled so we thought it was worth a try. To tell the truth there isn't a lot of difference between the new v's the old except the controller, it is worth the change on that alone. You have now got more control, it event switches the tv off plus it is Alexa enabled. Good buy for the controller alone.
customer_reviews.author: dcb

customer_reviews.title: Forced purchase
customer_reviews.text: Had to buy it or my Sony smart tv wouldn’t work with amazon prime from 26th Sept. Not happy I had to make the purchase but they gave £20 voucher towards it. Works perfectly manually Alexa integration not the best . Luckily my daughter has a fire stick for her camper van so left installation to her so cannot really comment on ease of installation.
customer_reviews.author: daiswan

customer_reviews.title: DOESN'T WORK!! WHY NOT???!!
customer_reviews.text: Question for seller, which is Amazon: why won't this model work on my tv/in N. England, when the old one (2 1/2 years old) works fine? This model loads ok, then freezes, tells me I've no internet connection(when I have), and no amount of switching off & on in any combination of stick, set or net fixes it??? This is the second one of this model I've tried. Both the same. No comments on voice etc. as never got that far.
customer_reviews.author: Sad Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Well the first few times of using it was ok. I tried to put it on this morning for the grandchildren but it said home page not available check internet settings. I did but couldn't get it past that stage. The internet is fine and fortunately I am still able to use the blue ray player for prime videos. I purchased the fire stick because Amazon said I won't be able to use the blue ray from September
customer_reviews.author: Sparkle

customer_reviews.title: Bit disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was very impressed with this new Fire Stick but after a few times, it started buffering and I haven’t bothered to use it since. May be it’s something to do with the WiFi so wouldn’t write it off, the old first generation one I had worked fine until the handset went wrong after a long time of usage. I will return to it and try and sort it out sometime. NOW SORTED. RESET MY ROUTER TO 2.4 INSTEAD OF 5. SEEMS FIRE STICK DOESNT WORK PROPERLY WITH ROUTER SET AT 5. NO PROBLEM NOW 🤞
customer_reviews.author: Milliecat

customer_reviews.title: Fire TV Stick - Unreliable - Constantly glitches after 10-15 minutes of viewing
customer_reviews.text: Bought from Amazon in Feb 2020 and have used as an alternative to TV aerial, as we have no aerial point in the room. Connected simpy enough to our Powerline internet extender, which was only 3 feet away from the televison with Firestick in full line-of-sight. After only a few days of using the device, the BBC iPlayer app and the ITB Hub app would start to "freeze" for no reason. I have tried unplugging the Firestick on numerous occasions (which 7/10 times resolves the issue) but it is becoming increasingly common, and also very irritating, as it involves getting up and resetting everything about 3/4 times an hour. Not a great product, probably why it got superceded?
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable Garbage
customer_reviews.text: This is the only device that seems to have issues with the WiFi connectivity in my house. I've tried different WiFi routers/hotspots, extenders, changing channels, different power adapters, HDMI extenders, etc. But at most I can get this Fire stick to work for 20 minutes until it cuts off any stream. Usually straight from the beginning there are network issues and the "Home is Unavailable" even if I've just restarted everything and then try to use the stick. Complete waste of money and unfit for purpose as of now. (And yes I've ran the updates and there are no further ones available according to the Fire Stick) 40 quid well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Towpillah

customer_reviews.title: Smart TV functionality
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with the fire-stick, I was considering upgrading my TV for a smart TV but the fire-stick has done the job for very little cost. I find it very responsive and has all of the main UK players so watching things like iPlayer is now possible and very easy. Before I purchased it I was a little concerned it would be too integrated with just Amazon prime services, but its not and all other players are fully integrated and easy to use. To save my wifi bandwidth I also purchased the Ethernet adapter which again works very well and means I can stream HD TV without soaking up the home wifi.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew King

customer_reviews.title: If you're outside US, U.K, Germany, India and Japan, you can't download apps on the firestick!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Amazon firestick in the UK to use in Pakistan, only to discover you can't download any apps like netflix if you're outside the above countries! Very disappointing, especially because Amazon should provide this info upfront at the time of purchase. I had to look long and hard for a help tab which finally put me through to someone who explained this via a chat facility. And sent me a link I would never have found! What is surprising is that other people are using the firestick in Pakistan. Amazon should ensure this kind of info is provided clearly at the time of purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ayesha Khan

customer_reviews.title: Good product, app layout poor
customer_reviews.text: The stick is a great product. I was really pleasantly surprised, especially for the money. The only thing I didn’t like is the layout of prime, (it’s the same layout as prime apps on every type of device) but would be good to have an option for only things that are prime. Why tease the kids with things I’m not gonna ‘rent’ Also it’s hard to find things in the app. The categories are rubbish. It could do with better search options or something like that. Voice recognition and Alexa integration are 4’s because I have barely used them. They’re not of any particular interest to me
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Plug and Play
customer_reviews.text: Simple to set up, the Fire TV stick seems pretty much fool proof. The voice activated facility is useful and it's the first time I've used Alexa in my home so I can't answer for the overall Alexa integration. However I have no reason to believe there would be any problem in this area. An excellent price this is a fantastic little gizmo that's easy to install and easy to use, I'm not sure why it's taken me so long to use all the facilities that having Amazon Prime offers. I purchased the cheaper version and it's more than adequate. I'm not even sure what the other one offers that this one doesn't.
customer_reviews.author: All-Seeing-Eye

customer_reviews.title: Awful
customer_reviews.text: Bought a firestick for our secondary tv for streaming purchases. Steaming pile of awful. It's slow, lags and all the prime suggestions make finding something a pain. The interface is a jumbled mess and if you press home or turn off, the video you were watching keeps playing losing your place next time you turn on. The only thing this thing has going for it is that it seamlessly connected to the tv and allows me to turn the tv on/off and adjust volume via the remote. In comparison to the Roku player which is similarly priced, it's awful. Get a Roku.
customer_reviews.author: Nath1790

customer_reviews.title: Bigger and Faster!
customer_reviews.text: I had an earlier version but wanted another for the bedroom TV. Having seen this one in action I've put the old one in the bedroom and use this as the main one. This first thing I noticed was that it was larger than the original and came with a fly-lead so it doesn't have to stick out beyond the screen. Secondly, the remote now has On/Off and Volume controls for the TV (where compatible) and finally the speed of the thing! Switching functions is now instantaneous and there is no break after the first few seconds of a stream. I'm almost tempted to ditch the old one completely and buy another of these.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: It had to be replaced and they still wouldn't send me the entire kit only parts of it!
customer_reviews.text: I seriously don't know what is wrong with Amazon! This gadget doesn't work and if you go to various youtube videos and websites and blogs you see 100's of people saying the same, sharing what to do to get it to work! I had mine replaced, twice and they never sent me the entire kit even though I asked for it!! I got one bit, then called up screaming and got another and so on. Honestly, don't bother! I wouldn't but I wanted to see Outlander on my TV instead of my laptop. Now after doing all that those websites say it works, which makes you wonder when one idea is just throwing it down on the floor!
customer_reviews.author: Shawn M. Cohen, BSc.Metaphysics, L.V.N.

customer_reviews.title: Very neat device, works beautifully
customer_reviews.text: Bought the Firestick to watch Amazon Prime videos - we already have Apple TV. My other half, who’s a total klutz with small fiddly items, had the battery in the remote in less than a minute. Setup went smoothly, and everything works. We even changed the HDMI switch box today (not enough sockets) and the Firestick reset itself and is working perfectly. Our Alexa is on my other half’s account and I’m the Prime member, so can’t comment on pairing with Alexa, but voice commands to the Firestick are fine. Very happy, and hopefully can now cancel some of our other subscriptions to save money.
customer_reviews.author: suzieb

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Present for my Father & not found to be good, he had limited HDMI sockets, plus he had already had Amazon charge him and his wife for 2 prime accounts for several months with no idea they had prime and had not signed up to Prime. If he had it would have been for the month of December (for football as well as presents). Sadly, they've lost trust and unsure they want to use this product as requires Prime. So disappointing, they can view it when I go to visit to see if they change their minds, but sadly, not sure they need or want to, no incentive with no football or programmes to their interest.
customer_reviews.author: Mia Rocket

customer_reviews.title: Great Streaming Product
customer_reviews.text: Another great product from Amazon. The fire stick is great, it has the ability to turn any old TV into a smart TV(requires Internet) I originally bought this product to increase usability of my daughters TV as it is a slightly older Samsung TV(2-3Years old), but due to this it was not able to run Disney plus on the internal smart TV. The fire stick sorted that out perfectly. Stream quality & picture quality is very good across all video applications. Fire-stick has the ability to have additional apps side loaded to fire-stick as well which is great to add additional streaming applications/ games etc. Overall this is a great product and would recommend purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worthwhile Upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I owned a first generation fire stick and bought this newer version because it was on sale any my old remote was getting a bit battered. This new model is slightly faster but, to be honest, the old version was perfectly usable. The main improvement is with the remote. It has voice control and Alexa (a poor substitute to the google alternative if you ask me) but, for me, the best addition is that the remote can now control the volume and power on/power off settings of your TV or sound system. No need to have both two remotes balanced on your arm rest.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Duerden

customer_reviews.title: It's a great remote and a quicker firestick too!
customer_reviews.text: I had to laugh and be a little creeped out when i was messing around and whispered "Alexa it's time for bed." Only to hear Alexa through my TV say "You whispered it's time for bed, would you like me to whisper back." Scary! But amazed at how great technology can be. Links to your tv and sound system. Had to select from the list for my sound bar but it found it being an obscure 'meidong' product (obscure to me anyway) volume buttons work fine and when I press the power button it turns off the TV, firestick and soundbar in one click. Faster startup and browsing than my gen 1 fireTVstick. Good little gadget for £24.99
customer_reviews.author: Neil.A

customer_reviews.title: Dubious utility.
customer_reviews.text: My BT freeview box came with Netflix, Prime Video and YouTube apps - all of which I can control (search titles, volume, pause etc.) from the wand. While the Firestick was easy enough to install and pair with Alexa, I'm still not sure what it r is really supposed to do. Once the wand is to hand it is just as quick to use physically by pressing buttons as a giving a voice command. Further, it easily get confused when searching by voice, and all too often I revert to back to physical not verbal use of the wand. I will keep as more of a toy and curiosity - but it adds little.
customer_reviews.author: JC Hargreaves

customer_reviews.title: Fire stick works well but amazon app on tv is pants
customer_reviews.text: The fire stick was easy to set up and works pretty well . I’ve also set up the plex app which works a treat . However, the rating looses stars because of poor customer service from amazon - I was forced to buy the stick because Amazon have not come back with a fix for the prime app on my tv which hangs and buffers constantly.
customer_reviews.author: G man

customer_reviews.title: An easy way to make a dumb TV smart again.
customer_reviews.text: My Samsung “Smart” TV lost all of its Apps and therefore all of the streaming services after a recent software update just before Christmas. As Samsung have been unable to solve the problem, despite several e-mails, I am left with a dumb TV. To quickly solve the problem I bought a Fire TV Stick, which provides the key catch-up and streaming services again. The Fire TV stick was quick and easy to set up and provides a much better experience than the previous Samsung Apps which were slow to load and frequently lost the wi-fi connection. I rarely use the Alexa feature but it seems to work when I do use it.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Super easy set up
customer_reviews.text: Plugged in and was up and running in less than 60 seconds, really. Amazon knows my Wi fi details already and connected instantly. Everything we have on our new smart TV we now have on our other much older TV's. Brilliant! Battery compartment no problem, just stuck my nail in and it opened easily. I haven't linked with Alexa yet but why bother. The remote is superb and so easy to use. Taking this on holiday, why not have the best TV while you are away............ Took it on holiday where we had a very old telly but it did have an HDMI socket ..... sorted. This is always going on holiday with us. Simply brilliant.
customer_reviews.author: Ray G

customer_reviews.title: easy to set up.  great quality streaming.
customer_reviews.text: Was pleased this came with the option for a passcode for keeping unsuitable content from a child. My 7yr old has already worked THAT out. Otherwise very pleased with it and the streaming quality is SO much better than through the smart tv. I thought I was buying it to continue watching amazon prime as it doesn't work on our tv any more. but it's so much better for everything we were streaming that it all goes through the stick now - Netflix, iplayer etc
customer_reviews.author: Paula

customer_reviews.title: Good option if you do not watch NowTV
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent streaming stick but is very Amazon directed. If you a constant user of Amazon Prime then it is prob worth having at least one of these in the house (if you do not have a smart tv with the Amazon app). Easy to use and easy to set up. The only real glitch on these Firesticks for me has been using the Eurosport channels on the TVPlayer app, the channel freezes for a second on a regular basis and does not freeze on a Roku stick watching the same channel at the same time. A streaming device is a good way to access internet streaming services and on demand options.
customer_reviews.author: M Hagues

customer_reviews.title: Awkward to use & insists on staying on
customer_reviews.text: Firstly, and very annoyingly, you cannot change the wakeup word. I wanted to call my Echo Dot "Alexa" and the Fire TV Stick "Amazon" but I can't. Secondly the wretched thing insists on switching my HDMI 5-way switch to its own channel and then blinks the LED on the switch continuously. Have to unplug its power at night to stop it driving us nuts. The menu system is extremely clunky and not at all easy to navigate. For some reason best known to the designers many of the channel icons are duplicated. The streaming seems OK but since its dependent on your WiFi connection it can deteriorate. Altogether not hugely impressed.
customer_reviews.author: BTRL

customer_reviews.title: tries to take over the world
customer_reviews.text: easy to set up apparently, plug it in and it works, however it reset my TV to factory defaults then locked its controls out until I worked out how to disable that so I could switch the soundbar back on - didn't recognise the soundbar so kept disabling the TV audio output to use the internal speakers which I didn't want. it works but "does not play well with others", would be nice for the default settings to be to just control itself and then ask before trying to automatically control everything else and mucking up the existing set up which was working just fine
customer_reviews.author: Leopard

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating so far.
customer_reviews.text: Only three stars at the moment as I have hardly used it. Firstly it was very fussy about which hdmi socket it would connect to. It didn't like the first two so had to move my other hardware connections around and it then worked on hdmi3. I particularly wanted proper access to PLEX but I cannot seem to access my files which work on PLEX on my newer TV. A tech friend is looking into it. I hope he can get it to work. Otherwise I will have limited use from it unless I sign up to Prime which I think is too expensive. I am prepared to give it a higher rating once it functions as I would like.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Phil

customer_reviews.title: Good at the right price.
customer_reviews.text: Automated tv switch on one button start from fire remote. Shame I was hoping my paired dots would be driven as Surround-sound speakers but it’s not having it at the moment so that’s a shame. Come on amazon sound integration is your strength. It’s just my bedroom setup but tv with two paired dots in the room would be nice to integrate all devices. With the Apps and a browser it replaces a windows tablet that was on the tv. It’s built to stream video so it’s better than the low end windows tablet at that. Got at reduced price and is worth the convenience factor.
customer_reviews.author: Mr P.A.A.

customer_reviews.title: Needs updates
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up. It was not hard to put batteries in remote, no tools or great technique reuired, just copy the diagram on the pack. Then.... set up registration all easy BUT then nothing would stream. Why??? Call to help and 55 minutes of online chat revealed that installing updates is essential. This should be mentioned in the set up instructions that come with the stick or the "how to" email that is sent. Now it streams very well. Excellent picture. I don't tlike Alexa or any of her friends but the remote is simple and easy to use. I tried Alexa a bit and either I or it could not cope with my complex demands.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Simples!
customer_reviews.text: I made a mistake when ordering an item from Amazon at Christmas 19. I pressed the wrong button and signed up for the Prime Trial Period. Still I thought I'd give it a go and sat watching 'Picard'. Well hooked! Fed up with watching my computer, an email arrived offering me the Fire TV Stick at a reduced rate. It arrived and thanks to idiot proof instructions I set it all up, and away we went. Still finding my way around it, but so far very content to have a great deal more to watch. Haven't yet been brave enough to go for Voice Controls, but maybe someday!. All I can say is go on give it a go.
customer_reviews.author: Howard

product_meta.title: Fire TV Stick with Alexa Voice Remote | streaming media player
feature_bullets: Our best-selling Fire TV Stick now with the Alexa Voice Remote (2nd Gen). Use the dedicated power, volume and mute buttons to control your compatible TV, soundbar and receiver.
Launch and control content with the Alexa Voice Remote. Watch favourites from BBC iPlayer, Netflix, Prime Video, YouTube, ITV Hub, All 4, Disney+, Apple TV and others (additional fees may apply).
Fire TV Stick devices have more storage for apps and games than any other streaming media stick.
Experience thousands of apps, Alexa skills and channels. Use Firefox or Silk to browse millions of websites like Facebook and Reddit.
Alexa on Fire TV provides the most comprehensive voice experience of any streaming media player—view supported live camera feeds, check the weather, dim the lights and stream music.
Amazon Prime members get unlimited access to thousands of movies and TV episodes, as well as ad-free listening to over two million songs with Prime Music.
No satellite? No problem. Watch live TV, news and sports with Eurosport, ITV Hub, Sky News and more.
